result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah H. Kollauf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Telephone Harassment, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Telephone Harassment, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Have mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
No contact with Tammy Hutkowski.
Write letter of apology to Tammy Hutkowski thru the agent.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Jeremiah H. Kollauf in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State files amended information (titled as amended criminal complaint)
Atty Renc received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 
Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1, 2 and 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 2 and 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Have mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
No contact with Tammy Hutkowski.
Write letter of apology to Tammy Hutkowski thru the agent.
Pay fine of $100 plus costs. 

Count 2:
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Comply with conditions on Count 1.
Pay costs. 

Count 3: 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Comply with conditions on Counts 1 & 2. 
Pay costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

Defendant Jeremiah H. Kollauf in court with attorney Anne J. Renc. Defendant Jeremiah H. Kollauf in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.  Document is filed.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah H. Kollauf in court with attorney Anne Renc. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$2,500 sig bond:  No contact with Tammy Hutkowski, any premises she is at,  her residence or place of employment.

DA case #14PT237
  Court calls case at   1:38 p.m.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Stalking & Harassment/Threat/Injunction.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State requests a $500 cash bond:  No contact with Tammy Hutkowski, her residence or place of employment.
Defendant states he is employeed and has family he needs to get home to and let the Court know he turned himself in.
415 Clinton Park.
